info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued July 03 at 9:45PM MDT until July 04 at 12:00AM MDT by NWS RapidCity
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1030 PM MDT FOR SOUTHEASTERN HAAKON AND NORTHEASTERN JACKSON COUNTIES... At 945 PM MDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 5 miles west of Ottumwa to 3 miles north of Nowlin to 4 miles northwest of Kadoka, moving northeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...70 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect considerable tree damage. Damage is likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings. Locations impacted include... Ottumwa, Nowlin and Midland. This includes Interstate 90 in South Dakota between Mile Markers 144 and 157. TORNADO...POSSIBLE THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: Remain alert for a possible tornado! Tornadoes can develop quickly from severe thunderstorms. If you spot a tornado go at once into the basement or small central room in a sturdy structure.
